name: ONEWORLD retreats Kumara

reviews.text: This place is amazing. One of the most gorgeous resorts I have ever stayed in - I would have loved to stay here even if I wasn't participating in a yoga retreat. The resort is built into the jungle cascading down a hill to a small river. The rooms are laid out so that each feels isolated from the other rooms. The view over the rice fields is really beautiful. The pool is gorgeous and so refreshing. The spa is lovely. The staff are amazing. They all knew our names after the first day! The food is also to die for. Ubud town is a short walk or a free shuttle down the road. Could not fault this place. Something for resorts all over the world to aspire to.
reviews.title: wow
One World Retreat, Ubud, bali
reviews.text: This was one of the most beautiful experiences I have ever had I think everyone should do it :)
I loved the Yoga and the Spa treatments were amazing! The rice field walk and trip to the volcano were some memories I will never forget!
reviews.title: One of the kind

reviews.text: I have travelled a lot, and have been to many five star health retreats but Oneworld retreat has more that others can offer! Only 15 min from Ubud this hidden serene place is mystically charming filled with loving energy and peace. It was very easy to come to Oneworld but very hard to leave!
reviews.title: A-M-A-Z-I-N-G!!! :)
Great accommodation but perhaps not ideal for non-retreat participants
reviews.text: Activities were unreal, great mix of quiet time and adventure!

I stayed at Kumara for a weekend package 17th August till 19th August, 2012 it was an amazing 3 days, warm welcome, I had room no. 10 and it was amazing, It was my first time doing yoga I really enjoyed it, it was hard but worth it. We then did a walk through the rice fields and had lunch at a wonderful organic restaurant, the food was delicious. It was my first time on my own and I was a little bit scared but they made you feel like family, the massages were too die for, the pool area was spectacular, I loved the little frangipanis that were put around your room after they make up the room, the little extras like paint, paper, pencils so you can draw if you want, the rooms are huge, comfy king bed, I cant say enough wonderful things about this resort it was Perfect for relaxation and peace and quiet. Thankyou Kumara for helping me to put a smile back on my face and peace in my heart ..
reviews.title: Amazing, relaxing, spiritual, fantastic, quietness.

reviews.text: Stayed for a week, including a five day Pilates and meditation retreat. Kumara essentially only caters for retreats so there were no other guests apart from our group of 11. The rooms are beautifully designed, they do differ slightly, but all have quality bedding, spacious balconies and large bathrooms. The air conditioning is excellent. The bathrooms are probably not quite at the standard of the rest of the retreat but they are perfectly adequate. All the staff were fantastic, great service and fabulous food. Complimentary shuttle service is available down the hill to the centre of Ubud if you feel compelled to shop, however its only a 20 minutes walk. The Spa service was outstanding, if you visit Kumara, try every treatment you can fit in!
reviews.title: Excellent retreat, perfectly balanced activities and great value.

reviews.text: A refreshing, cool, lime juice and a warm, friendly smile was to be the start of an amazing and unforgettable week. The staff at Kumara are wonderful and ever so helpful. The food is amazing!! Then there's the massages and treatments. (OMG the massages!) And of course there's the yoga.
reviews.title: Perfection at its best

reviews.text: Kumara is great for those wanting to reconnect and treat themselves or to just to find themselves again. The retreat was fuel for the mind, body and soul. For a week I felt like royalty with all the pampering and delicious meals.The retreat was perfection at its best.
reviews.title: Perfect holiday for body, mind & spirit

reviews.text: Hats off to Kumara and the team!! Such an amazing experience!!!
reviews.title: Amazing Life Experience

reviews.text: This retreat is absolutely one of the kind! I can't even begin to say how amazing it is. The owners have done such an phenomenal job. From day one to the very last minute, everything is thoughtfully planned out. The staff are the kindest, always smiling and courteous. The spa treatments are the best with a breathtaking view to look at. The food is delicious and exciting. The rooms are clean and very nice and the place is close enough to Ubud that you can either walk or take the complimentary ride for less than 10 minutes.
reviews.title: Find your inner goddess

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: All together,It's truly a priceless experience. It's spiritual, cultural and fun at the same time. You can be sure you'll leave this place totally zen, connected and balanced.
reviews.title: Escape from the world

reviews.text: We had a lovely time at the Oneworld retreat. The yoga was good, the extra curricular activities fun (yoga on a deck overlooking a volcano, cycling - more downhill gliding than cycling! The blessing by a priest, rice field walk and lovely lunch at Sari Organik. Learning the Balinese way of making an offering. All of these were great cultural experiences for our group). The room was clean and comfortable. The food was very good and you did not feel like you were being punished even though the emphasis is on healthy food. Lots of vegies! They probably need to serve larger helpings to the male attendees but that is a small gripe. Beautiful peaceful environment, apart from some construction noise, slightly annoying during the fabulous spa treatments. Great staff.
reviews.title: Perfection

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I continued to be blown away for the entire course of the retreat, it was absolutely wonderful in every way. Blissful and enlightening. Skilled in the art of happiness. Certainly the focus is on personal development, which it nurtured very successfully; but I also very much enjoyed the sensitively incorporated insight into Balinese culture, always accessible and from a perspective of personal relevance.
reviews.title: Paradise

reviews.text: Highly recommended.
reviews.title: Absolute Relaxation

reviews.text: I loved every minute of our 5 days at Kumara. The rooms are spacious with beautiful views of the rice fields. The 5 days were extremely well organised and there was enough time to do your 'own thing', have massages and just enjoy your surroudings. The yoga with Iyan and Wayan was fantastic! It was hard to believe that the food was so healthy - choc mousse made with avocado yum. Ive missed the ginger tea as it was a great way to kick start and end the day. The staff went out of their way to help. This was excellent value for money and I hope to do another retreat soon.
reviews.title: Beautiful and relaxing retreat

reviews.text: What a fantastic yoga retreat! The accommodation was very spacious, clean and modern – and with beautiful views. The staff were excellent – they couldn’t help you enough and everything was very organised. The yoga was intense but really good – I would recommend that you have some yoga experience, however Iyan and Wayan catered really well to different levels of experience. A highlight was yoga during sunrise at the volcano – incredible! All the activities were really well planned and so lovely – the team are really thoughtful and the activities gave a great taste of Balinese culture. The food during our stay was great! Healthy and really tasty (and I wasn’t expecting three course dinners every night...yum!). The spa treatments were also great, so relaxing and a great spa vicinity – the Mandi Lulur flower bath was a highlight. We had a lovely mix of people from around the world in our group which also added to the experience. Overall, the retreat really was fantastic – it exceeded my expectations in every facet and was also fantastic value for money. In addition, we really felt that the retreat was for us and that the team at OneWorld do all that they can to make sure that everyone enjoys their time there. Every detail was so thoughtful (down to the water colours and paintbrushes in the room, and the incense gifted to us on our departure). I thoroughly recommend OneWorld Kumara for a fantastic (and great value for money) holiday / retreat – I’m hoping I can go back!
reviews.title: Amazing - couldn't ask for more

reviews.text: My decision to attend this particular retreat was a no-brainer after reading all the positive reviews. I went to Bali specifically for the retreat and what attracted me was the fact it was all inclusive of transfers, meals, massages, activities and the Yoga. Had I stayed somewhere else in Ubud, it is likely, I would not have had the motivation to attend as much Yoga as was part of the timetable at Kumara - the Yoga and meditation was ...nurturing. This was my first sojourn on my own and I loved every minute, though I did Skype back home every day. Loved meeting people from other states and countries. The healthy food was amazing and I am looking forward to getting the recipes.Tip come a day earlier, so you can book an extra massage and a pedicure. Yes the pedicures are likely more expensive, than in Ubud, but it was sooo relaxing with an endless cup of sweet ginger tea, overlooking the beautiful landscape. Next time I won't bother with bringing my yoga mat, it took up too much space, but I will bring another pair of bathers as mine took a long
reviews.title: Nurturing

reviews.text: while to dry in the humidity. I did use the laundry which was efficient and nominal. The staff are all truly exceptional, from the morning bell ringer to the teachers Iyan and Wayan. I am looking forward to my next trip with great anticipation.
reviews.title: Pure Iyengar Yoga

reviews.text: I had a absolutely wonderful time at the yoga retreat at Kumara. Kumara an outstanding place to stay at, the yoga was excellent, the activities fun ( purification ritual at the temple, yoga overlooking a volcano, cycling, rice field walk, learning how to make a Balinese offering), very friendly staff, spa treatment very good, comfortable rooms, food was delicious.
reviews.title: Relax and enjoy

description: ONEWORLD retreats Kumara is remarkably peaceful: the location offers 10 well appointed rooms, 2 swimming pools, dining room, lush gardens, wonderful views of the rice fields and a spa offering high quality treatments including our renowned Ayurvedic Chakra Dhara Massage.The resort is located in Ubud, where famous artists and writers from the world over have found peace and serenity including Elizabeth Gilbert who recently wrote about Ubud in the best seller Eat Pray Love.
